snippet: Enrique Marquez is the crucial if unlikely figure in the rampage investigation. Acquaintances say he often used to talk about sleeper terrorist cells.
abstract: Acquaintances of Enrique Marquez, childhood friend of San Bernardino shooter Syed Rizwan Farook, say Marquez often mused about terrorism but was not taken seriously; authorities hope that Marquez will provide some insight into why couple with no obvious connections or sympathies with terrorist groups were enticed toward violence.

byline.original: By IAN LOVETT, JACK HEALY, MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and JULIE TURKEWITZ
byline.contributor: Ian Lovett, Jack Healy and Julie Turkewitz reported from Riverside, and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Eric Schmitt and Scott Shane from Washington, and Rick Rojas and Adam Nagourney from San Bernardino, Calif. Susan Beachy and Jack Begg contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Enrique Marquez is the crucial if unlikely figure in the rampage investigation. Acquaintances say he often used to talk about sleeper terrorist cells.

headline.main: San Bernardino Attackers’ Friend Spoke of ‘Sleeper Cells’ Before Rampage
headline.print_headline: Friend Talked of Sleeper Cells Before Rampage
